qas.question: What is responsible for directing all ground traffic in designated areas?
Who instructs vehicles on which taxiways to use?
When a plane is ready to take off, who takes over the direction of a plane?
When is control turned back over to ground control?

plausible_answers.text: directing all ground traffic in designated "movement areas"

qas.question: What are stair trucks responsible for?

plausible_answers.text: where they will park, and when it is safe to cross runways

qas.question: What are two things Ground Control instructs Tower Control to do?
When a plane is ready to take off what does it do before being turned over to Ground Control?
When a plane lands what does it do before returning to Tower Control?

plausible_answers.text: planes, baggage trains, snowplows, grass cutters, fuel trucks, stair trucks

qas.question: What are some examples of ground traffic Tower Control directs in designated areas?

context: <a0_0>Ground Control<a0_0/> is responsible for <b4_0>directing all ground traffic in designated "movement areas"<b4_0/>, except the traffic on runways. This includes <b8_0>planes, baggage trains, snowplows, grass cutters, fuel trucks, stair trucks<b8_0/>, airline food trucks, conveyor belt vehicles and other vehicles. <a1_0>Ground Control<a1_0/> will instruct these vehicles on which taxiways to use, which runway they will use (in the case of planes), <b5_0>where they will park, and when it is safe to cross runways<b5_0/>. When a plane is ready to takeoff it will <b6_0>stop short of the runway<b6_0/>, at which point it will be turned over to <a2_0>Tower Control<a2_0/>. <a3_0>After a plane has landed<a3_0/>, it will <b7_0>depart the runway<b7_0/> and be returned to Ground Control.
